sponsor.partnerMessage: Nathaniel Rateliff & the Night Sweats will be at the Walmart AMP on Friday, April 22 with Robert Earl Keen and Devon Gilfillian. Enjoy this musical blend of indie rock, blues, Americana, folk & more. Lawn tickets starting at $35. Buy now at amptickets.com!

posts.title: Local Publisher Releases Summer Camp Guide
posts.content:
Summer is a couple of months away, but we’re all starting to dream about it a little bit, right? There are numerous options in Northwest Arkansas for summer camps for kids that can potentially start funneling those dreams into fun summer plans!

  • The guide: Macaroni Kid, a Fayetteville Publisher, recently published a 2022 NWA Summer Camp Guide that includes over a dozen camps for kids ranging from 5 to 18 years old.
  • The camps: TheatreSquared will be hosting multiple theatre camps throughout the summer. The NWA Martial Arts Academy and the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will be hosting day camps, and the Young Chefs Academy is offering multi-day camps weekly from May-August. 

See Macaroni Kid’s Summer Camp Guide HERE.

posts.title: Eureka Springs Makes Top Spot In Best Mountain Town List
posts.content:
Southern Living recently released another article in its annual South’s Best series, and Eureka Springs was featured in one of the top spots on the list of The South’s Best Mountain Towns 2022. 

  • The list: The South’s Best series celebrates the most noteworthy places and communities, and Eureka Springs made the No. 5 spot in the mountain towns category. 
  • The town: Eureka Springs is a town with a population of just over 2,000 people, nestled in the Ozark Mountains near Beaver Lake. It’s known for its art culture and architecture, and its downtown is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. 

See the full list of The South’s Best Mountain Towns HERE.

posts.title: Dance Company Presents Workshop And Performance At WAC
posts.content:
This Thursday, Los Angeles-based Activist Dance Theatre company CONTRA-TIEMPO is coming to Northwest Arkansas for a week-long residency, which includes a free dance masterclass and a public dance performance at the Walton Arts Center.

  • A workshop: The masterclass will be rooted in CONTRA-TIEMPO’s unique dancing style which incorporates Salsa, Afro-Latinx social movement forms, and improvisation. The class is scheduled for Thursday, April 14 in Star Theater, and registration is required to participate. 
  • A show: The performance will be on Saturday, April 16 as a participatory experience featuring several dancers from NWA. The experience is called joyUS justUS and is based on personal truths about the power of hope, faith, and family. 

Learn more and register for the masterclass HERE.

posts.title: Monster Truck Show Coming To Bentonville
posts.content:
For all of you who played with monster trucks as kids and have never seen one in real life, your time has come. The Monster Truckz Extreme Tour is coming to the Benton County Fairgrounds this weekend and discounted tickets are available!

  • Launching cars: The Monster Truckz Extreme Tour just might be the wildest thing you ever witness with trucks destroying cars and flying over jumps. The Nuclear Motocross Team will be present also, performing thrilling tricks and soaring 75 feet above your head. 
  • Action-packed: Get tickets for a show Friday-Sunday for you and your child aged 3-13 for only $16.50! Each show will be an hour and a half and is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat. 

Learn more and get your tickets HERE.

posts.title: Breweries Coming & Going, Brew Events In NWA
posts.content:
The Arkansas beer scene is better than ever before, but it’s also going through some changes. 

  • Old and new: JJ’s Brewing Co., the brewery that exclusively supplied Northwest Arkansas’s JJ’s Grill, has officially closed its doors, but when one leaves another one takes its place. A new small-batch brewery called Goat Lab Brewing Co. recently opened in Lowell. 
  • Brews and brewers: There are also plans for a new brewery to open in Springdale called Mothership Brewhouse. As for brew events, The Art of Home Brew Showcase will be in Siloam Springs on Saturday, May 14 featuring over 20 beers and ciders. 

Read the full Fayetteville Flyer story HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Tickets: Here's Fare Flight NWA with the latest on affordable airfares.
  • Giving: A U of A Alumna recently donated $6 million to the University.
  • Tech: The Bentonville West Robotics Club is entering a world competition.
  • Community work: The NWACC and community recently built 30k kids' beds in one day.
  • Progress: The City of Bentonville recently hosted a State of the City Presentation and said it hopes to make it an annual occurrence.
